text: John F. Meister (May 10, 1863 - January 17, 1923) was an American baseball player. Meister played two seasons in Major League Baseball, 1886–87, for the New York Metropolitans, primarily as a second baseman. He was listed in the Allentown, Pennsylvania directory of 1888 as a "professional" baseball player. He was the third son of Charles and Louisa Meister. After his baseball career was over, John Meister owned a liquor store, a tavern, and then a restaurant. ==External links== *Baseball Almanac Category:Major League Baseball second basemen Category:Major League Baseball center fielders Category:New York Metropolitans players Category:Meriden (minor league baseball) players Category:Waterbury (minor league baseball) players Category:Meriden Maroons players Category:Hartford Dark Blues (minor league) players Category:Hazleton (minor league baseball) players Category:Worcester Grays players Category:Lebanon (minor league baseball) players Category:Lebanon Cedars players Category:Binghamton Bingoes players Category:Rochester Flour Cities players Category:Allentown Colts players Category:Harrisburg Senators players Category:Sportspeople from Allentown, Pennsylvania Category:1863 births Category:1923 deaths Category:Baseball players from Pennsylvania Category:19th-century baseball players
title: John Meister
